channel.title: Comments on: An offender by any other name?

item.title: By: Marguerite Schinkel
item.dc:creator: Marguerite Schinkel
item.description: Thanks Claire, I agree with you about the tagline - it seems to presuppose the findings. In my PhD research I had a lot of findings that chime with what you describe as the second sentence: even the long-term prisoners who wanted to turn their life around found it hard because there were no opportunities for them to, for example, get a job.
item.content:encoded: Thanks Claire, I agree with you about the tagline – it seems to presuppose the findings. In my PhD research I had a lot of findings that chime with what you describe as the second sentence: even the long-term prisoners who wanted to turn their life around found it hard because there were no opportunities for them to, for example, get a job.

item.title: By: Claire Lightowler
item.dc:creator: Claire Lightowler
item.description:
Really interested to read more about your research Marguerite.
I find your notion of persistent punishment clear but having a title around "The meaning of" perhaps implies there is one meaning? Is it more meanings of, or experiences of?
This also made me reflect on a discussion at an event about distant voices facilitated by Vox Liminis, for further info see http://blogs.iriss.org.uk/voxliminis/. Here we started to explore the concept of the second sentence imposed by society, in this case following release from prison. Very different discussion but I thought it might be of interest.
item.content:encoded:
Really interested to read more about your research Marguerite.

I find your notion of persistent punishment clear but having a title around “The meaning of” perhaps implies there is one meaning? Is it more meanings of, or experiences of?

This also made me reflect on a discussion at an event about distant voices facilitated by Vox Liminis, for further info see http://blogs.iriss.org.uk/voxliminis/. Here we started to explore the concept of the second sentence imposed by society, in this case following release from prison. Very different discussion but I thought it might be of interest.
